devdoc.details: Mock implementation of Chainlink VRF Coordinator for local development

acceptSubscriptionOwnerTransfer(uint64).details: will revert if original owner of subId has not requested that msg.sender become the new owner.

params.consumer: - New consumer which can use the subscription

params.to: - Where to send the remaining LINK to

createSubscription().details: You can manage the consumer set dynamically with addConsumer/removeConsumer.Note to fund the subscription, use transferAndCall. For exampleLINKTOKEN.transferAndCall(address(COORDINATOR),amount,abi.encode(subId));

returns._0: minimumRequestConfirmations global min for request confirmations
returns._1: maxGasLimit global max for request gas limit
returns._2: s_provingKeyHashes list of registered key hashes

returns.balance: - LINK balance of the subscription in juels.
returns.consumers: - list of consumer address which are able to use this subscription.
returns.reqCount: - number of requests for this subscription, determines fee tier.

params.consumer: - Consumer to remove from the subscription

params.newOwner: - proposed new owner of the subscription

devdoc.title: MockVRFCoordinatorV2

addConsumer(uint64,address).notice: Add a consumer to a VRF subscription.

getRequestConfig().notice: Get configuration relevant for making requests

removeConsumer(uint64,address).notice: Remove a consumer from a VRF subscription.
